Reviews.Title: “Good location ...but that's all”
Reviews.Author: Dafna T
Reviews.Content: only one advantage :good location . other than that , Tiny room , not clean , staff not nice . NO AC . water not running well in the shower.toilet not clean and not enough towels ( we did not receive even after asking several times). Don't think that I'll ever book there again .

Reviews.Title: “not a great impression”
Reviews.Author: kedav7
Reviews.Content: This was booked at the last minute with it's main points being location and price. However, it was not in good upkeep. Rooms were very small and squashed. Bathroom was not very good standard at all. Good for one night only. Good location though if that's what you want.

Reviews.Title: “The decoration of the room was ugly and outdated but who cares when the hotel is located in an excellent location and th”
Reviews.Author: nilizio
Reviews.Content: External form of this hotel is very poor but does not reflect the final output of the tourist from the hotel. Decoration of the rooms also outdated, ugly and bad taste. But who cares? The hotel is located near the Republic Square. National Street within spitting distance of the beautiful and full of shops .. Breakfast - a medium quality. Clean sheets, changed every day, the staff was welcoming and helpful, room was clean. The price that we paid for the deal (flight + hotel) - definitely worth it. We received good value for our money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, standard room.”
Reviews.Author: ynth
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a short and easy walk from the train statione, right off of Via Nazionale, and about a 3 minute walk from the metro. The Colosseum, Trevi Fountain, and Pantehon are all in walking distance. In fact, I walked everywhere I went to in Rome and took the metro to the Vatican. The room was a bit tight, but the bed was large, hard, but not too uncomfortable. The bathroom was alright, and they really stocked you with shampoo and bar soap. There was a locked safe in the closet and the key is on the same key chain as the door key. My air conditoner kind of leaked, but since it was hardwood floors the cleaning ladies took care of it. The staff was okay. Nothing too comforting or helpful. The front door was actually locked past midnight, which is a bit outrageous since the bars and restaurants seem to close even later than that! You can buzz into the front desk though, but t is just a bit inconvenient. The breakfast was alright, as was the coffee. Free WiFi only in the common area on the first floor. This hotel is nothing special, but if you can get a deal on the price I'd say it is worth it. The location is perfect for someone who walks from place to place, like I did. Also, this hotel, I'm 98% positive is handicap accessible.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: travellerest
Reviews.Content: We were at this hotel for 3 nights unfortunately. Pokey in size, dirty, shower was broken (we reported but not attended to) dim lighting. Front desk staff unhelpful. Definitely minimum of 4 star hotels in Rome after this experience.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for the money we paid”
Reviews.Author: Hemi_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel for 4 nights. The room is comfortable and large enough. There is mini bar in the room, and Hot water in the lobby 24 hrs. so you can make coffee tea or any hot drink you want. The staff is friendly. The location is excellent and you can reach the sites by walking or public transportation from and to any where you want. All 4 of us familiar with different hotels in Europe and this one is much better than the others.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: lmeven
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is great. Close to all the interesting places. 2 minutes from Piaza Republica & from Metro, although we did most of the sites by foot. Rooms are tiny but clean. Hot water with strong stream. Room is quite dark. not enough light for reading. Noise from the street disturbed our sleep. We did not sleep so well but it did not bother us so much.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, Safe Location close to transport links”
Reviews.Author: SkaroTrips
Reviews.Content: We were only using the hotel as a base while sight-seeing and its location is perfect for that. The area felt very safe which made the location perfect being so close to the main rail station and metro. As it was just off the main road some traffic noise was to be expected but we had the windows and shutters closed at night as its cool in October, so this wasn't intrusive. The room was OK for size, not huge but we didn't intend to stay in it for long during the day. The bathroom had been refurbished recently but the shower was very small and the door was very narrow to get through, plus the door leaked making the floor wet and slippery to get out after wards. The shower itself was very good though. Plenty of towels were provided. Bed was comfy and sheets clean, extra pillows were in the wardrobe. The safe in the room was locked but we didn't need to use it anyway. The flooring was laminate so no dirty carpet. The paintwork on the walls could do with a touch-up in places. Breakfast was basic but OK. Tip, don't have coffee from the machine in the breakfast room, its awful! get one of the people there to make you a real one from the machine behind the 'bar', much better and it doesn't cost anything. The orange juice tastes very much like orange squash too. The staff we had dealings with were all pleasant and helpful. Overall its was fine, perfect to use as a base for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good value for your money”
Reviews.Author: Espi52
Reviews.Content: I had stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. The location is good, close to Rebublica Metro. The room is a tiny box with no sound protection. It was hard to sleep at night. The front desk service ranged from OK to miserable depending on who was sitting there (so many). One even got annoyed when asked about the location and direction for a restaurant. He sounded as if "Dont you see I am busy here. Go figure yourself". However, the staff at breakfast place were very nice. Overall, it is not a good value for your money. SP, Denver Colorado

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location only”
Reviews.Author: changezi
Reviews.Content: Didn't have a choice, booked one day before my flight. Amazing location - Issues: - very dim lighting in the rooms - breakfast very very basic - sheets could be cleaner - Dirty carpet - Street noise in the room Recommend only if budget constraints; although i ended up paying $200 a night! Rome hotels are very expensive if you plan in the last moment.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for price”
Reviews.Author: alexa1973
Reviews.Content: Basic hotel, very small rooms (I didn't see rooms that size ever :) ), but clean. Basic breakfast. Friendly staff and good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location- basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: lizaol
Reviews.Content: We've been at hotel last week. The location is GREAT, veru close to metro, all attractions- this is the "key" of the hotel. Rooms are basic, not light, not something special. Also the breakfast very poor, but it was enough for us! There is Macdonald's near the hotel and supermarket- not very expensive- we have bought a lot of food there, many shops, buses, metro! So... it's ok but not to be there all the day- only resting... NO computers with internet, WI FI- not sure.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place To Rest Your Head”
Reviews.Author: Romeisgreat
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed in Paris Hotel For 4 nights in May. The location of this hotel is worth the money. The Hotel is right on Via Nazionale (one of the main streets with lots of shops, pubs and bus lines), 200 meters from a Metro station, And it's just 6-7 minutes by foot from Termini station. You can also go anywhere in Rome by foot if you want, nothing is too far from this hotel. There's a small breakfast, the rooms are not the cleanest but not dirty either and the beds are great after a long day's walk. We slept there like babies. If you plan on staying out all day exploring Rome and just need a place to rest your head and feet, Paris hotel is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: barnloves2travel
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews and people are right - its a great location but this is as much as it goes. The rooms are typical closet size as most places in Europe (Although we had big rooms in Venice and Florence). The tv's are 8 x 8 inches and have converters so that they can receive digital signal. \i have been on the email for about an hour and about 6 different people have come down to complain that they do not work (including us). The carpets have not been washed since time immemorial - and I am not quite sure if the bed spreads have.been washed recently. The flloors in the halway and in the bathrooms are clean. They have free wifi behind the reception area. While i is considered budget hotel it is still 100 euros a night and to me this is a bit excessive even for Rome. If you want cheap - the price is cheap but the accommodations are rudimentary - very rudimentary. We had booked for a week and cancelled and stayed only for one night - they did not put up a fight. Again - you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “NIce budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: RomanGliwice
Reviews.Content: We were looking for clean budget hotel in Rome and we found it. Hotel situated in a heart of Rome, very close to metro . Quite a big room (208) with a moderate bathroom. Good breakfast. One thing I didn't like : big noise coming from the room next to ours when using shower, tab or toilet

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, cheap price!!!”
Reviews.Author: BeateAndPatrik
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed here in a double room, and my wifes mother in a singular room. Fantastic location close to Republica and near Termini Station. We did not have big expectations to this hotel because of the very cheap price of the rooms... Because of thiswe were satisfied with our stay here. But be prepared, very small rooms, and a ltttle trouble with a crazy shower. But the room was reasonably clean (clean enough for my pregnant wife), the bathroom was clean. But if you are not used to a little backpacking or are on a honeymoon, stay away from this hotel. If you are used to travel, you will have an okey stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Comfortable Accomodations, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: LetzGotravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very centrally located. It is within walking distance from the Termini Station and Repulica Metro Station, as well as many other landmarks in Rome. We were given a triple room although we only paid for a double, which gave us an extra room for our luggage. We spent a total of 12 nights at the Hotel Paris and were very nervous about the beds, since both my husband and I have back problems. The beds were firm and provided the right amount of support we needed and had no issues whatsoever. The linens were clean and crisp. The rooms and bathrooms do have older decor, but they are roomy and clean. We've traveled to Europe and many other countries and I have to say, the staff here was some of the most helpful people we've met. Their front desk personnel as well as their breakfast servers and housekeeping staff were friendly, courteous and a true joy. Breakfast consisted of coffee (they make cappucino and expresso) as well as very good croissants (my husband loved them), italian cold cuts, yogurt and cereal. This was plenty to get our day started. I would definitly recommend this hotel if you are budget minded. It is no frills, but accomodations, staff and location are good. Overall, we didn't have any complaints....although I wish they had wifi in the room as opposed to the lounge area.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but problem with shower”
Reviews.Author: icequeen_10
Reviews.Content: Was pleased with the location of the hotel which was central and handy to Termini station. The amount of space was great, we actually had a room each and the hotel was surprisingly quiet for a city centre hotel. Breakfast was adequate, you didn't have a problem getting enough to eat. We had a problem with the shower, water gushed from the base and flooded the bathroom floor every time it was used. I reported it to reception as I was worried it would flood the room below but it was never fixed while we were there. Staff were pleasant but most seemed to have trouble understanding what we were saying

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money - Great location”
Reviews.Author: davidgilmor1
Reviews.Content: We did not want to spend much money for the stay but we were afraid that lousy hotel will ruin our vacation. After reviewing this site we decided to try Paris Hotel and it seems like our choice was great. The room is clean and nice, the service is fine, breakfast is continental but the staff is nice and trying to do its best for you. The location is great, right on the main street where you can find all the right buses, 5 min walk from Termini and 1 min from the metro. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: vasodesidra
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on the via Nazionale, the main street in Rome, is close to the Coloseo, Foro, Vitorio Emanuele, all the main tourist attractions. It's also near Termini station, very nice restaurants in the area and a bar open till late round the corner. I stayed for 5 nights in a big triple room, 302, it was clean and nice, we do not have any complain about it. Breakfast is downstairs, the lady is Italian and is very nice and chatty, breakfast is not luxurious but for me was ok, you have coffee, orange and pineapple juice form the machine, croissants (delicious), ham, peperoni, bread, butter, jam... Although is not a five star the hotel is very comfortable, we had a lovely stayed there. I will recommend it .

Reviews.Title: “The most unpleasant hotel I've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: iksander1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Paris hotel recently in what turned out to be one of my most unpleasant stays at a hotel EVER. The room was small, which I had anticipated, given: a) this is Rome and b) the price. However, the service at this hotel is seriously lacking. You must climb stairs in order to catch the lift. The wi-fi connection works every now and then. At one point, I went down to the reception as I had to send an urgent email and the internet was not working; the girl at the counter very rudely told me the internet was working and that I should try to connect at the dining area (which is next to the front desk. Only she said she could not turn on the lights, as the on switch was on the second floor... I don't think I need to clarify that this was not the case at all... My room had a leak near the bathroom sink AND had roaches. When I went down to the reception to complain, they said they would "send someone right away"... at 1am? I don't think so... I immediately asked for a room change, which I got, only to trade the roach infested room for a disgustingly moldy scented room... lovely! And the carpets in the room seem to have never been cleaned, just touch them and wash your hands... you'll see all the dirt wash out. The A/C being restricted to certain hours of the day is also extremely irritating. They do, however, have few accommodating staffers, such as the young girl, who I'm guessing is the owner's youngest daughter; she was always very polite and tried to help out with directions on a couple of occasions. As well as a very kind Italian woman who does the housekeeping. She even tracked me down to let me know I had left a few belongings after having switched rooms in a hurry. Also, the rooms have a tiny safe to store valuables. There is an advisory in the room that states that the hotel is not liable for goods stored in the in-room safe, and that for better protection, you should leave your goods in the hotel safe. So I decided to leave a few items at the reception to put in the hotel safe while away. When I returned, I asked for my belongings at the front desk and there they were, right next to the receptionist. In other words, there is no hotel safe, which they didn't bother to let me know, even though their signs clearly indicate otherwise. Overall, my stay at the Hotel Paris was a very unpleasant experience. Although the hotel is 'conveniently' located on via Firenze, very close to Reppublica metro, lacking customer service and the poor condition of the rooms I stayed in and the property in general are enough to turn me away from staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Slavaf1977
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very basic, good value for money (in my opinion) and what is most important - excellent location! The place is very quite, stuff is OK (friendly enough), breakfast is good one. Liked our stay there, will recomend it for people who come to see Rome and stay in the hotel (don't have any facilities, placed in former appartment building).

Reviews.Title: “Good location but thats all”
Reviews.Author: LanarkshireTraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last year - I did not book it so did not check reviews on this site like I normally do. I agree with some of the reviews I have just read. Hotel is in a great location but thats about it. Staff were not friendly at all and it always seemed to be a hassle for them anytime I had a query. Rooms were very basic - I don't mind this as long as they are clean however our bathroom had leaks and had a constand bad smell. Would not reccomend it to anyone. Also, from my memory it wasn't cheap so does not offer value for money. I have written reviews about numerous hotels and this is the only bad one I have ever written so please take my word for it and look elsewhere. Loved Rome though and didn't spend much time in room so not all bad.

Reviews.Title: “Simple room.”
Reviews.Author: gln126
Reviews.Content: You can take bus 64 from the terminal or walk to the hotel. You can either buy a single ride ticket for one euro or a one day bus and metro ticket for four euros at certainTabacchi. (You can ask people where is the Tabacchi) The elevator made loud thumping sounds when it was moving. We checked into room 303. It was a simple but nice room. The Chinese guy at the reception desk was helpful. (The staff speak Mandarin) There was a supermarket located at 211/213 Nazionale Street. (2 1/2 blocks away from the hotel - about 3 minutes walk). Make sure you bring or own bag to hold your groceries or they will charge you for a bag. The hotel was within walking distance from the Colosseum. (That is if you don't mind walking) When you visit the Vatican city, make sure you wear something that covers your shoulders and pants that cover your knees. Or you will be wasting your time waiting in the long lines. There are at least two security check points. It's free to visit the Vatican city. On the other hand, the entrance fee to the Sistine Chapel is 13 euros. However, it is free from 9:00 - 12:30 on certain days.

Reviews.Title: “Do not recommend”
Reviews.Author: 4_TravelersColorado
Reviews.Content: Just returned from staying at this hotel (May 29-31, 2007) and felt the need to post this review. First, we did not let this hotel experience ruin our wonderful time in Rome. However, we would not recommend this hotel to anyone! The front desk employees (except for Michaela) were rude, unwelcoming, always on the computer, etc. We were reprimanded upon our arrival because the number of people staying in the rooms versus the number of people our travel agent had booked did not match. Our room was not clean, there was an odor (sewer smell) in the bathroom, the bathtub had mold growing around the caulking. We always felt like we were bothering them if we needed to ask questions or had requests for extra towels, directions, etc. Overall, this was a horrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: grahamfin
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a party of 10 at the Paris for 3 nights in March07 The hotel oganised transfers to and from the airport - worked well. The staff were all excellent in manner and helpfullness. Rooms were clean and tidy - everything worked! Breakfast was good All in all excellent value for money and if I return to Rome I would use again

Reviews.Title: “Extremely poor value”
Reviews.Author: naplessorrentolondon
Reviews.Content: Due to a late booking, rooms in Rome were difficult to obtain. Now I know why this hotel was available. It is described as having an elevator, but one must walk up stairs to get to it. It is described as having air conditioning, but this is available at only certain hours of the day. Even though the hours of operation, including nighttime hours are posted on the controls, the A/C was not available at night. The explanation was after September 15 no air conditioning would be provided at night. However it was still very warm and opening the window only let in noise from a very busy street below. Between the heat and the noise sleeping was difficult. The staff was not helpful. Nice glass ice buckets are provided, but to get ice one must ask the desk agent. In our situation, a small amount of ice was provided from a regular ice cube tray from a kitchen refrigerator. Rooms are small which is not unexpected but seemed smaller because of the heat. Cleanliness acceptable. Our reservations were actually for 2 nights, but we arrived in the morning rather than the previous night. I expected to pay for the full 2 days reservations but when I asked the manager to waive the minibar fees (2 waters and a beer) because of our inconvenience with the A/C he refused. My impression that the hotel's policy is to maximize income and minimize convenience.

Reviews.Title: “The location is this Hotel's best feature”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Paris in October 2005. We arrived late and, despite our emailing in advance to say we had a late flight, they had a problem with room allocation and we found ourselves in separate, single rooms, for our first night in the Eternal City. The rooms were so small that you could lie in bed and touch the opposite wall. They changed our room the next day and it was more like dormitory - two single beds positioned foot to foot. Again the room was very small and narrow. It's my guess that most of the rooms will be very small and somewhat dark. Overall, the Hotel is looking a bit 'well used' although the rooms while not spotless, are clean. The good bits? The location is great, just a short walk to the Trevi and right in the middle of lots of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Yuk”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night only and we were glad it was only one night. Very basic room and basic breakfast with horrible coffee. We had stayed for 4 nights before at the Rezidence Cellini around the corner, which was only €20 more a night and incomparably better. The Hotel Paris is perhaps better than sleeping on the street.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were walked here by the Notti a Roma B&B across the street and stayed for E90. The room was the tiniest we had throughout Italy--literally had to walk sideways between bed and wall. Bath was small, but both rooms were clean. They had not turned on the A/C yet so we had to keep the windows closed to keep out the noise--thank goodness it cooled off enough at night. Breakfast was a buffet of breads, toast, juice, and coffee. Staff was nice.

HotelInfo.Name: Paris Hotel Rome
HotelInfo.Address: Via Firenze 57, 00184 Rome, Italy
